properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 9:38AM CST until January 14 at 3:49AM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following river in
Illinois...

Skillet Fork River at Wayne City

.Heavy rainfall over the past 36 hours in Southern Illinois has
caused water levels to rise along the Skillet Fork River. The river
is forecast to reach flood stage at Wayne City later this morning
and crest at a major flooding level of 20.2 feet Sunday morning. The
river will fall below flood stage Monday night.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Skillet Fork River at Wayne City.
* until late Monday night.
* At  9:00 AM Saturday the stage was 14.2 feet.
* Flood Stage is 15.0 feet.
* Major flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by late this morning and continue
to rise to near 20.2 feet by tomorrow morning. The river will fall
below flood stage by Monday before midnight.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
